title: This Parliament will never deliver a proper Brexit - an election is the only way forward
text:
The EU is highly likely to grant the UK an extension of Article 50 up to January 31, in line with the date requested by Parliament. There is noise about how President Macron of France might lowball by offering just an additional couple of weeks - forcing MPs to choose between backing Johnson’s deal and a no-deal Brexit - but other member states will recognise the risk this creates.

The Benn Act allows for one shot at an extension, it cannot be fired again. If MPs failed to use a short extension to make a decision - something their intransigence to date suggests is likely - then the EU would be responsible for no deal. They will want to avoid this outcome. Given President Tusk will enable the...
description: The EU is highly likely to grant the UK an extension of Article 50 up to January 31, in line with the date requested by Parliament.
